p: In vitro reproductive technologies in the domestic cat ( Felis catus) would be useful not only for this species but also for the conservation of endangered feline species [ 20]. As generation of feline blastocysts using in vitro culture (IVC) is very difficult because of the “morula block” [ 22], several studies have been undertaken to improve the IVC process [ 16, 21]. Significantly better results were obtained when a two-step culture was used and the culture medium was changed on day 2 or 3 than when a one-step culture was used [ 5, 21]. Specifically, the addition of fetal bovine serum (FBS) instead of bovine serum albumin (BSA) in the late period of culture was a key factor for the improved results.
